com.wordpress._0x10f8.logcheck.rule

Interface Rule

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRule, CompositeRule, ContainsRule, SingleLineRegexRule, SurroundingMatchContainsRule

    public interface Rule
    Rule interface, defines that rules must have a name and the ability to evaluate a log file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<RuleMatch> evaluate(java.io.File logFile)
      Evaluate the log file with this rule.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the rule name.
      void setName(java.lang.String name)
      Set the rule name

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the rule name.
        Returns:
        The rule name

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the rule name
        Parameters:

      • evaluate

        java.util.List<RuleMatch> evaluate(java.io.File logFile)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Evaluate the log file with this rule.
        Parameters:
        logFile - The log file
        Returns:
        A list of rule matches indicating where in the log file matched the rule
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there was an exception reading the log file
